intro: Isotrema annamense, commonly known as the Annamese Isotrema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Isotrema annamense is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles in its native habitat.
